text.0: :money_bag: A message circulating on WhatsApp claims that Nigeria’s federal government is offering millions in business grants. Don’t fall for it - the message is a scam. https://t.co/wVqFYsXCy0
text.1:
How to communicate uncertainty: at @FullFact, with 
@Chequeado and @AfricaCheck, we've produced a briefing on how fact checkers - and others - can best communicate uncertainty in a way that can be understood and interpreted by audiences #misinformation https://t.co/lZ3lUi83C2 https://t.co/ygRnuBxTlj
text.2: Conspiracy theories: new #misinformation research briefing from fact checkers @FullFact, @Chequeado & @AfricaCheck on the who, how and what next of conspiracy theories that can cause serious harm when beliefs turn into behaviours https://t.co/7ao5PLtKIi https://t.co/68wylY9XgS
text.3: :candle_selector: [ANALYSIS] Can South Africa’s electricity utility Eskom blame the “coldest winter in 10 years” for load shedding during the country’s Covid-19 lockdown? We asked weather experts. https://t.co/DTF9pdp2YH
